intro: Sterculia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar sterculia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has a woody stem and broad, palmate leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas of the rainforest. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
